title.text: Arabic Diacritization through Full Morphological Tagging

abstractContent.text: We present a diacritization system for written Arabic which is based on a lexical resource.
It combines a tagger and a lex-eme language model.
It improves on the best results reported in the literature.

introductionContent.text: Arabic is written without certain orthographic symbols, called diacritics, which represent among other things short vowels.

The restoration of diacritics to written Arabic is an important processing step for several natural language processing applications, including training language models for automatic speech recognition, text-to-speech generation, and soon.
